title: Study Puts Cost of Medical Errors At $19.5 Billion
author: Katherine Hobson
description: Most of that total came from medical care and prescription drugs to people injured by errors.
cleaned_text: Aug. 9, 2010 3:04 pm ET Medical errors and the problems they can cause -- including bed sores, post-op infections and implant or device complications -- cost the U.S. economy $19.5 billion in 2008, according to a [study released today](http://www.soa.org/files/pdf/research-econ-measurement.pdf). (That's enough to buy almost 1.3 billion copies of The Checklist Manifesto, Atul Gawande's bestseller on [reducing such errors via the lowly checklist](http://blogs.wsj.com/health/2009/01/15/a-simple-surgical-checklist-saves-lives/).)
